source: Media playback is not supported on this deviceDel Potro secured a 3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3 victory over the Swiss player.The Argentine is 165th in the rankings after missing more than two years because of injury problems.Del Potro, who is in the same half of the draw as Britain's Andy Murray, will next play either France's 32nd seed Lucas Pouille or American Donald Young.I am pulling for Del Potro and every player in the locker room is. No player deserves what he has had in the last three or four years.Former US Open champion Del Potro, 27, reached the Wimbledon semi-finals in 2013 but the former world number four is playing in his first Grand Slam since the Australian Open in 2014 after having three wrist operations.He struggled early on as Wawrinka, 31, claimed an early break before comfortably taking the opening set, but Del Potro fought back well to take the second.Both players broke serve twice in the opening four games of a thrilling third set, which Del Potro won in a tie-break, before taking the fourth set to wrap up victory."It feels amazing," Del Potro told BBC Sport. "I beat one of the guys who is playing great tennis this season and I couldn't have expected this before today."I enjoyed the crowd, they were incredible and I'm very happy."It is my second or third career now after all the injuries. I was sad for the last two years and now I am enjoying playing tennis again. I feel alive."Media playback is not supported on this deviceAustralia's Nick Kyrgios is also in the same half of the draw as Murray and remains on course to meet the world number two in the last 16.The number 15 seed came from two sets to one down to beat Germany's Dustin Brown 6-7 (3-7) 6-1 2-6 6-4 6-4 in a thrilling, rain-affected second-round match on Court Two.The pair had only played three points before a rain delay of more than three hours with the German, ranked 85th in the world, then clinching the first set on a tie-break.Kyrgios swept through the second set in just 15 minutes but Brown regained the advantage by taking the third.However, the Australian then won the fourth to move level and, after another rain delay, clinched the fifth set to reach round three.Spanish 22nd seed Feliciano Lopez will play Kyrgios in the third round, with the winner of that tie then playing either Murray or Australian John Millman in the last 16.Lopez fought back from two sets behind to defeat Italian Fabio Fognini 3-6 6-7 6-3 6-3 6-3.Elsewhere, there were routine victories for 10th seed Tomas Berdych and 12th seed Jo-Wilfried Tsonga.Berdych beat Germany's Benjamin Becker 6-4 6-1 6-2, while Tsonga triumphed 6-1 6-4 6-3 over Juan Monaco of Argentina.You can now add tennis alerts in the BBC Sport app - simply head to the menu and My Alerts section
summary:
Juan Martin Del Potro, ranked 165th due to injury issues, won a challenging match against Stan Wawrinka (3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3) at Wimbledon. Del Potro, who reached the semi-finals in 2013, is in the same half of the draw as Andy Murray. He will face either Lucas Pouille or Donald Young next. Del Potro had three wrist operations and this is his first Grand Slam since the Australian Open in 2014.

Nick Kyrgios, ranked 15th, also advanced in the same half of the draw as Murray. He came back from two sets to one down to beat Dustin Brown (6-7 (3-7) 6-1 2-6 6-4 6-4) in a rain-affected match. Kyrgios will face Spanish 22nd seed Feliciano Lopez in the third round, with the winner potentially facing Murray or John Millman in the last 16.

Routine victories were also

summary: Argentine tennis player Juan Martin del Potro secured a 3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3 victory over Swiss player Stanislas Wawrinka. Del Potro, ranked 165th, is playing in his first Grand Slam since the Australian Open in 2014 after undergoing three wrist operations. He will next face either France's Lucas Pouille or American Donald Young. Nick Kyrgios, ranked 15th, also advanced to the third round after defeating Germany's Dustin Brown in a rain-affected match. Spanish player Feliciano Lopez, ranked 22nd, overcame a two-set deficit to beat Italian Fabio Fognini. Top seed Tomas Berdych and 12th seed Jo-Wilfried Tsonga also won their matches.

Here's a concise summary of the key information from the passage:

1. Juan Martin del Potro defeated Stan Wawrinka in a four-set match at Wimbledon.

2. Del Potro, ranked 165th, is making a comeback after missing over two years due to injuries and multiple wrist surgeries.

3. This is Del Potro's first Grand Slam since the 2014 Australian Open.

4. Nick Kyrgios won a five-set match against Dustin Brown in a rain-affected game.

5. Kyrgios will face Feliciano Lopez in the third round, with the winner potentially meeting Andy Murray in the last 16.

6. Other results included victories for Tomas Berdych and Jo-Wilfried Tsonga.

Del Potro, a former US Open champion, has battled injuries and multiple wrist surgeries, making his comeback at this Grand Slam event. The match saw both players trading breaks in a tight contest, with Del Potro ultimately prevailing in a tie-break in the third set. The Argentine expressed his joy at the win and the support from the crowd. The article also mentions Nick Kyrgios' progress in the tournament, his comeback win against Dustin Brown, and potential future matchups. Additionally, it covers the victories of Feliciano Lopez, Tomas Berdych, and Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in their respective matches.

Here is a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

* Juan Martin del Potro, ranked 165th, defeated 4th seed Stan Wawrinka 3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3 in the second round of a Grand Slam tournament.
* Del Potro, who has been out for over two years due to injury, will next play either Lucas Pouille or Donald Young.
* Del Potro's victory was his first in a Grand Slam since the Australian Open in 2014, after having three wrist operations.
* In other matches, Nick Kyrgios came from two sets to one down to beat Dustin Brown, and will play Feliciano Lopez in the third round.
* Lopez will then play either Andy Murray or John Millman in the last 16, while other winners included Tomas Berdych and Jo-Wilfried Tsonga.

I feel alive."Media playback is not supported on this deviceAustralia's Nick Kyrgios is also in the same half of the draw as Murray and remains on course to meet the world number two in the last 16.The number 15 seed came from two sets to one down to beat Germany's Dustin Brown 6-7 (3-7) 6-1 2-6 6-4 6-4 in a thrilling, rain-affected second-round match on Court Two.The pair had only played three points before a rain delay of more than three hours with the German, ranked 85th in the world, then clinching the first set on a tie-break.Kyrgios swept through the second set in just 15 minutes but Brown regained the advantage by taking the third.However, the Australian then won the fourth to move level and, after another rain delay, clinched the fifth set to reach round three.Spanish 22nd seed Feliciano Lopez will play Kyrgios in the third round, with the winner of that tie then playing either Murray or Australian John Millman in the last 16.Lopez fought back from two sets behind to defeat Italian Fabio Fognini 3-6 6-7 6-3 6-3 6-3.Elsewhere, there were routine victories for 10th seed Tomas Berdych and 12th seed Jo-Wilfried Tsonga.Berdych beat Germany's Benjamin Becker 6-4 6-1 6-2, while Tsonga triumphed 6-1 6-4 6-3 over Juan Monaco of Argentina.You can now add tennis alerts in the BBC Sport app - simply head to the menu and My Alerts section
summary: Juan Martin Del Potro, ranked 165th after a long injury hiatus, defeated Stan Wawrinka 3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3 in a comeback match at a Grand Slam, his first since the 2014 Australian Open. Del Potro, who has undergone three wrist surgeries, expressed joy at his victory and return to tennis. In the same tournament, Nick Kyrgios overcame Dustin Brown in a rain-affected match, winning 6-7 (3-7) 6-1 2-6 6-4 6-4 to advance to the third round, where he will face Feliciano Lopez. Lopez also made a comeback from two sets down to beat Fabio Fognini. Additionally, Tomas Berdych and Jo-Wilfried Tsonga secured straightforward wins in their respective matches.
